Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon

Class DepthLayerInterval

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon.DepthLayerInterval
public class DepthLayerInterval extends Object
Strictly vertical containment regions that can use depth or layer ids to define point containment. If neither are defined points are contained. This object is used in conjunction with SurfaceRegion objects to form the basis definition of Region objects that provide for 3D combinatorial containment regions.
Author:
jrhipp

      Sets the depth range limits within which a point is deemed to be contained by this DepthLayerRegion.
      Parameters:
      d0 - The top depth of the valid range.
      d1 - The bottom depth of the valid range.

      Returns:

    • isPointContained

      public boolean isPointContained(double depth) throws IOException
      Returns true if the input point depth is contained within depth interval.
      Parameters:
      depth - The points depth (km).
      Returns:
      True if the point is contained within the depth interval or no interval was defined.
